intro: Erythrorhipsalis pulchra, commonly known as the red-leafed string of hearts, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and striking red-tinged foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets.
